snippet: A Congressional Budget Office report shows the Affordable Care Act costing less in part because of the broad slowdown in the growth of health care costs.
abstract: Congressional Budget Office says insurance expansion under the Affordable Care Act will cost $1.383 trillion over the next decade, more than $100 billion less than previous forecasts; attributes lower cost in part to broad and persistent slowdown in growth of health care costs.
lead_paragraph: A Congressional Budget Office report shows the Affordable Care Act costing less in part because of the broad slowdown in the growth of health care costs.

headline.main: Budget Office Lowers Estimate for the Cost of Expanding Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: Budget Office Lowers Estimate for the Cost of Expanding Health Coverage

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
